title: How can modern man achieve spiritual enlightenment without the assistance of ancient initiation centers?
first_phrase: In this final section of the text, the author discusses the challenges faced by modern man in his quest for spiritual enlightenment. He argues that the traditional methods of initiation are no longer available and that one must find a different approach based on the faculties of the higher self. The author also cautions against other methods that may lead to only fleeting experiences, as opposed to a lasting transformation. The concept of the 'destruction of the unconscious' is also introduced, as an alternative to the 'superstitious' approach of modern psychoanalysis. These ideas are important in understanding the author's perspective on the nature of spiritual development.
